sections.purpose: To evenly spread microbial inoculum over the surface of agar plates using sterile, single-use spreaders.
sections.scope: Applicable to plate count and isolation techniques in Microbiology.
procedure: Open the sterile pack of disposable spreaders near a flame or inside a biosafety cabinet.
Pour the measured volume of inoculum onto the center of the agar surface.
Gently move the spreader in a back-and-forth or circular motion to distribute the inoculum evenly.
Avoid pressing too hard to prevent gouging the agar.
Dispose of the used spreader immediately into a biohazard sharps or waste container.
Close and invert the plates as per SOP and incubate.
Record the sample ID and dilution on the plate.
precautions: Ensure spreaders remain sterile until use.
Avoid touching the working end of the spreader.
Dispose of used spreaders as infectious waste.
Do not flame disposable plastic spreaders.
